intro: Psychotria macrocarpa, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant ecological and cultural importance in the regions where it is native.
